IzhikevichNetworkSimulator#

Module Contents#

Classes#

IzhikevichNetworkSimulator

This class runs the simulation of the network of neurons.
class IzhikevichNetworkSimulator.IzhikevichNetworkSimulator(current_components: src.CurrentComponents.CurrentComponents)#

This class runs the simulation of the network of neurons.

Every neuron in the system can be described with a 2D system of ODEs:

\(dp_v / dt = 0.04 p_v^2 + 5 p_v + 140 - r_v + I_v\),

\(dr_v / dt = \alpha_{\mathsf{type}(v)} \cdot (\beta_{\mathsf{type}(v)} p_v - r_v)\), if \(p_v \geq 30\) mV, then \(\begin{cases} p_v \leftarrow \gamma_{\mathsf{type}(v)} \\ r_v \leftarrow r_v + \zeta_{\mathsf{type}(v)} \end{cases}\),

where * \(v\) is a neuron, * \(\mathsf{type}(v)\) maps a neuron to its type (see NeuronTypes), * \(p\) represents the membrane potential of the neuron, * \(r\) represents a membrane recovery variable; provides negative feedback to \(p\), * \(\alpha\) describes the timescale of \(r\) (see constants.IZHI_ALPHA), * \(\beta\) describes the sensitivity of \(r\) to the subthreshold fluctuations of \(p\) (see constants.IZHI_BETA), * \(\gamma\) describes the after-spike reset value of \(p\) (see constants.IZHI_GAMMA), * \(\zeta\) describes the after-spike reset of \(r\) (see constants.IZHI_ZETA), * \(I\) describes the current (see CurrentComponents).

This neural dynamics model is introduced in [Izhikevich, 2003].

Parameters

current_components (CurrentComponents) – contains methods of computing the neural network current components.

Variables

_current_components – contains methods of computing the neural network current components.

simulate(self, simulation_time: int, dt: float) → src.IzhikevichNetworkOutcome.IzhikevichNetworkOutcome#

Runs the simulation.

Parts of the code in this function and its components are rewritten from MATLAB code listed in supplementary materials of [Lowet et al., 2015].

Parameters

  • simulation_time (int) – number of epochs to run the simulation.

  • dt (float) – time interval

Returns

collected information from the simulation.

Return type

IzhikevichNetworkOutcome

_get_izhi_parameters(self) → tuple[numpy.ndarray[int, float], numpy.ndarray[int, float], numpy.ndarray[int, float], numpy.ndarray[int, float]]#

Allocates Izhikevich parameters \(\alpha, \beta, \gamma, \zeta\) to all neurons.

Returns

Izhikevich parameters.

Return type

tuple[numpy.ndarray[int, float], numpy.ndarray[int, float], numpy.ndarray[int, float], numpy.ndarray[int, float]]

_get_initial_values(self, izhi_beta: numpy.ndarray[int, float]) → tuple[numpy.ndarray[int, float], numpy.ndarray[int, float]]#

Creates initial values for the membrane potential and recovery variable.

Parameters

izhi_beta (numpy.ndarray[int, float]) – Izhikevich parameter \(\beta\) for all neurons.

Returns

initial values for the membrane potential and recovery variable.

Return type

tuple[numpy.ndarray[int, float], numpy.ndarray[int, float]]

_get_change_in_recovery(self, potentials: numpy.ndarray[int, float], recovery: numpy.ndarray[int, float], izhi_alpha: numpy.ndarray[int, float], izhi_beta: numpy.ndarray[int, float]) → numpy.ndarray[int, float]#

Computes the change in membrane recovery.

Computes \(dr_v / dt = \alpha_{\mathsf{type}(v)} \cdot (\beta_{\mathsf{type}(v)} p_v - r_v)\).

Parameters

  • potentials (numpy.ndarray[int, float]) – neurons’ membrane potentials.

  • recovery (numpy.ndarray[int, float]) – recovery variables.

  • izhi_alpha (numpy.ndarray[int, float]) – Izhikevich parameter \(\alpha\) for all neurons.

  • izhi_beta (numpy.ndarray[int, float]) – Izhikevich parameter \(\beta\) for all neurons.

Returns

change in membrane recovery.

Return type

numpy.ndarray[int, float]

_get_change_in_potentials(self, potentials: numpy.ndarray[int, float], recovery: numpy.ndarray[int, float]) → numpy.ndarray[int, float]#

Computes the change in membrane potentials.

Computes \(dp_v / dt = 0.04 p_v^2 + 5 p_v + 140 - r_v + I_v\).

Parameters

  • potentials (numpy.ndarray[int, float]) – neurons’ membrane potentials.

  • recovery (numpy.ndarray[int, float]) – recovery variables.

Returns

change in membrane potentials.

Return type

numpy.ndarray[int, float]
